revised_title: Sarcoplasmic Reticulum and Mitochondria as Cation Accumulation Sites in Smooth Muscle
tldr: The article discusses the role of sarcoplasmic reticulum and mitochondria in the accumulation and regulation of cations, particularly calcium, in vertebrate smooth muscles. It describes the structure and function of the sarcoplasmic reticulum and its relationship with the surface membrane, as well as the potential role of mitochondria in regulating intracellular cation levels. The study finds that smooth muscles with a larger volume of sarcoplasmic reticulum can contract even in calcium-free solutions, suggesting a connection between the structure and function of smooth muscles.
